0P0000TJA8.F.manager_bio:
Stephanie Bigou holds a Master's Degree in Economics, Econometrics & Statistics from Toulouse School of Economics and a Master's Degree in Mathematics applied to Finance from Toulouse School of Economics. Stephanie began her career in 1998 at BNP Paribas Asset Management as a quantitative analyst specialising in U.S. equity markets. In 2004, she moved to the Economic Research team at BNP Paribas Asset Management, as an Economist specialising in emerging markets. In 2006, she joined Ixis Asset Management as an Economist specialising in emerging markets within the Economic and Strategy team. One year later, her coverage has been extended to the developed countries. In 2008, she became a world-wide strategist within the Asset Allocation Department at Natixis Asset Management, and portfolio manager of Flexible Funds.
Stephanie is currently a senior portfolio manager within the Flexible and Volatility team at Seeyond (that became an independent subsidiary of Natixis Asset Management in 2018).

ACAAGG.MI.summary: Investimento principale in strumenti finanziari rappresentativi del capitale di rischio e in strumenti di natura monetaria ed obbligazionaria. In particolari situazioni di mercato il Fondo potrebbe essere investito totalmente in strumenti finanziari rappresentativi del capitale di rischio oppure totalmente in strumenti finanziari obbligazionari a breve termine o monetari. Investimento residuale in OICR, anche promossi e/o gestiti dalla SGR (OICR collegati), che investono nelle predette categorie. Investimento in strumenti finanziari di uno stesso emittente in misura superiore al 35% del patrimonio a condizione che siano emessi o garantiti da Stati membri e Stati OCSE. PossibilitÃ  di investimento in depositi bancari in misura al piÃ¹ contenuta. Gli investimenti sono denominati in euro e nelle valute dei principali paesi di riferimento.

ATMPLF.MI.long_name: ATOMO - Plab Flex Absolute Fund L EUR Acc
ATMPLF.MI.summary:
The objective of the Sub-Fund is to seek long-term capital growth by combining different assets without geographical nor currency constraints.
The Sub-Fund investment strategy is long bias, world allocated and strong diversified mainly through ETFs and Funds.
It will follow a top-down approach to determine the allocation between asset class, regions and sectors, emphasizing relative value valuations to determine the core investments and an opportunistic approach based on short term indicators, trying to generate positive returns both in the short and long term, with a limited volatility.
As the focal points of our process, the Sub-Fund tries to form proprietary insights into our investments through quantitative and fundamental research. Portfolio management techniques are used to balance the investments and hedge the undesired risks, looking at the âimplied correlationâ between asset classes to reduce total portfolio volatility.
